meanings.definition: To be silent, morose, and bad-tempered out of annoyance or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, Tim sulked in the corner, feeling upset.
meanings.sent2: She sulked for hours after her friends didn't invite her to the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat sulked when it saw the empty food bowl, demanding attention.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds sulked in the sky, ready to burst with rain.
meanings.sent5: His sulked expression made it clear he was in a bad mood.

meanings.definition: To show resentment by refusing to talk or be sociable.
meanings.sent1: When his brother teased him, he sulked and wouldn't respond.
meanings.sent2: She sulked at the family gathering, upset about an argument.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man sulked at the park, avoiding conversations.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds sulked overhead, casting a shadow over the picnic.
meanings.sent5: Her sulked behavior made it clear she was upset with her friends.
